title: Hello! My name is Fangzhou (Eric) Liu!
text:
Instagram
  
  
     ORCID
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Hello! My name is Fangzhou (Eric) Liu!
I am a full-time biostatistician in the Department of Population and Quantitative Health Sciences at Case Western Reserve University, as well as part of the Thoracic Oncology Program at University Hospitals. Meanwhile, I am also a part-time first-year Clinical Translational Science PhD student.
My work spans cancer epidemiology, health outcomes research, spatial analysis, and applied machine learning. I specialize in R, Python, Tableau, and ArcGIS Pro, and I am passionate about building rigorous, reproducible analyses that support scientific discovery and real-world decision-making.
I am involved in several projects that integrate clinical data and social determinants of health. My current research includes cancer outcomes analysis using large administrative datasets, time-to-event and survival modeling, and spatial studies examining health disparities across communities.
Outside of research, I enjoy photography, travel, and spending time with my wife, Yuan, and our cat, Kaba.
Welcome to my website, and thank you for visiting!
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential collaborations.

title: Education & Experience
text:
Experience

Research Associate
Case Western Reserve University, School of Medicine - Department of Population and Quantitative Health Sciences | Cleveland, Ohio | 2023 - Present

Managed and prepared datasets from multiple studies for analysis
Developed and implemented statistical analysis plan, analyzed data on R or SAS
Prepared for posters/publications in consultation with PI for manuscripts and outcome reporting
Data visualized with Tableau and ArcGIS Pro.



Biostatistician
University Hospitals - Thoracic Oncology Program | Cleveland, Ohio | 2024 - Present

Collaborated with clinicians and physicians to analyze large-scale survey data, providing actionable insights to support medical research and clinical decision-making.
Lead the design and execution of GIS projects, integrating spatial data to inform public health strategies and healthcare planning.
Applied advanced statistical techniques to a variety of healthcare-related datasets, ensuring accurate and meaningful results for research publications and hospital operations.



Graduate Teaching Assistant
Case Western Reserve University, School of Medicine - Department of Population and Quantitative Health Sciences | Cleveland, Ohio | 2024 - Present

Assisted in delivering advanced lectures and facilitating discussions tailored to Graduate and PhD students.
Provided expert guidance on methodologies for analyzing large healthcare datasets, including advanced statistical software and data management techniques.
Collaborated with the course instructor to design rigorous assessments and evaluate student performance at the doctoral level.

title: Photography Collection: Life With Kaba
text:
This gallery features eight of my favorite photos, all centered around our cat Kaba, who is truly the heart of our home. Four of the photos capture special moments between my wife and Kaba, showing their bond and everyday happiness.
The final two photos include a bit of Kaba’s mischievous personality:

One shows my wife with Kaba, sitting next to the book he bit.
The other is me with Kaba, with the same “victim” book (different places though) in the background.

Together, these images tell a small story about our little family — the love, the playfulness, and the funny moments Kaba brings into our lives.
